NewsContent: Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight Here's a look at her life and career through the years. Hide Caption Here, Rodham talks about student protests in 1969, which she supported in her commencement speech at Wellesley College in Wellesley, Massachusetts. Hide Caption Hide Caption Also seen in the photo is Hillary Clinton, center background. Hide Caption They talk to Don Hewitt, producer of the CBS show "60 Minutes." Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption After taking office, President Clinton chose his wife to head a special commission on health care reform, the most significant public policy initiative of his first year in office. Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption The first lady was subpoenaed to testify as a witness in the investigation of the Whitewater land deal in Arkansas. Hide Caption Hide Caption He became the first sitting president to testify before a grand jury when he testified via satellite about the Lewinsky matter. Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption She was running for the Democratic presidential nomination. Hide Caption Also pictured are U.S. Rep. Dennis Kucinich of Ohio, left, and former U.S. Sen. Mike Gravel of Alaska. Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption After pulling out of the presidential race, Clinton thanked her supporters and urged them to back Barack Obama to be the next president of the United States. Hide Caption Hide Caption The two endured a long, heated contest for the 2008 nomination. Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption Hide Caption She tells CNN, "I feel so relieved to be at the stage I'm at in my life right now ... Because you know if I want to wear my glasses, I'm wearing my glasses. If I want to wear my hair back I'm pulling my hair back. You know at some point it's just not something that deserves a lot of time and attention."
